conclusion: Analyze refraction of light beam through optical element to determine length of PM.
Rectangle ABCD has length 2L and width L; light enters at midpoint P of AB; incident angle is 37 degrees; refractive index is 4/3.
Snell's Law: n1 sin(theta1) = n2 sin(theta2); n1 = 1, n2 = 4/3.
Determine theta2 as sin^(-1)(0.45) approximately 26.74 degrees.
Use tangent of theta2 to find PM: tan(theta2) = L / PM.
Calculate PM as L / tan(26.74 degrees) approximately L / 0.5.
